review: Only been using this for an entire day now, but here's my first impressions.It's pretty good.  I don't love it.  It's funny how much Amazon vaunted the specs, yet this doesn't perform any better than any other device I've used.  (I currently have two Rokus and one Apple TV.)  The UI actually seems a tad choppier than the Apple TV.  I'll admit that it's better than my Rokus, but they're a couple generations old.  Regardless, I'd have thought that with the specs they published it would be smooth as silk, and it's just not.Also, I *really* wish there were a way to skip the annoyingly long introduction.Still, at the cost, it's a fine unit.  Hope they get more channels.
author: A. Falco

review: More useful than a Chromecast because it does not require a separate device to play content.  The Chromecast is basically a receiver dongle that lets your TV receive content from a connected device; i.e. Android, IOS tablets, PC or Mac.  The FireTV stick has the brains inside of it and after it connects to your wi-fi then connects to your Internet provider.  The content options appear to be nearly endless.  There are a variety of both free and paid options and if you are a Prime member then all of the standard Prime content is free.  FireTV stick also has apps for your phone to let you connect and stream directly or just use your phone for a keyboard and search tool and then start the video playing on your TV.
author: Ron R.

review: I have a question about the product. When I try to connect the stick to a Hotel TV and try to use the Hotel's web protected WIFI, it does not allow me to enter the credentials to access the WIFI - I heard from Amazon support team that this feature is not supported at this time. Without which, I do not see any use of this product if it cannot allow to use a paid high-speed protected WIFI. I also feel stick is extremely slow - I tried to use my LTE MIFI network - It cannot play anything. Bandwidth was extremely high when I measured it in the device. I have a fire TV connected at home, I feel it works better - not carried with me to a protected WIFI to compare the performance.
